Additional XPath Data 2:
ACROCLINIUM ROSEUM 'RED BONNIE'
 b102
Great play of colors from dark pink to light pink with a dark or yellow center. Grows 50 to 60 cm tall and flowers all summer. Tolerates full sun. Snail proof. For dry bouquets, cut just before they are fully ripe.

Additional XPath Data 2:
BLUE WOODRUFF
  b105
Asperula azurea. Delicate, blue flowers. Prefers sunny and semi-shady position in well draining soils. The plants with whorled leaves will grow to 30 cm in height.
Positive for pollinators: Yes

CALIFORNIA POPPY
b135
Eschscholzia californica, delicate annual poppy variety with golden-yellow flowers. Will also do well in dry positions. Approx. 30 cm in height; can self-seed in suitable locations.

CALIFORNIA POPPY 'KARMINKÃ–NIG'
 b136
Eschscholzia californica (crimson), delicate Californian Poppy with crimson flowers, approx. 30-40 cm in height; for dry locations. Easy to combine with other summer flowers.

CHINA ASTER (SUMMER)
b115
Callistephus chinensis, good as a cut flower, but also useful in summer for beds and borders. Simple flowers in white, pink, and purple. Approx. 80 cm high; in cultivation since 1728.

CHRYSANTHEMUM (EDIBLE)
b123
Undemanding edible chrysanthemum, also attractive for its flowers. Both the young leaves , as well as the buds and flowers, can be eaten raw, cooked as a vegetable, or used to make a tea. Will grow to 50 cm in height.

NEW
CLARKIA 'AZALEENSCHAU'
  b138
Large, silky-smooth in a range of colours from white to red with various pink shades in between. This low-maintenance, long-lasting branching plant grows up to 30 cm tall. Great as a potted plant and for cut flowers.
Positive for pollinators: Yes

COMMON MARIGOLD 'GOLDEN PRINCESS BLACK CENTER'
 b117
70 cm high, very old marigold variety with a strong stem. The golden yellow flowers with their double, dark center look beautifully lively thanks to the play of colors from dark purple to red. Suitable for cutting and insect-friendly. Petals are edible

Additional XPath Data 2:
COMMON POPPY
 b173
Papaver rhoeas, annual, if sown in autumn biennial and flowering the next summer, with large bright red poppy flowers. Will reach approx. 50-60 cm in height. Cut flowers best at budding stage.
Positive for pollinators: Yes

COREOPSIS
b129
This summer plant with yellow and brownish red flowers, is also used for dyeing. A good flower for cutting or for borders. Approx. 50-80 cm high.

CORNCOCKLE
b103
Agrostemma githago. Formerly a common sight in cornfields, but nowadays rare. Black seed, poisonous. Flowers in June if sown in spring, or in June if sown in autumn. Flowers purple, height ca. 50-100 cm.

 b137

DOUBLE-FLOWERED PINK POPPY FROM FLAMATT
  b176
Pink poppies with large, densely filled flowers. These approximately 1 m tall, early summer-flowering plants are reminiscent of peonies.
Positive for pollinators: Yes

FOUR O'CLOCK FLOWER
b162
Mirabilis jalapa, in height 60-100 cm. Flowers of different colours, sometimes bicoloured ones, can appear on a single plant. The colours range from white, yellow and pink to red and purple. A multitude of flowers all summer long.

IPOMOEA PURPUREA
b153
Climber with blue to violet, trumpet-shaped flowers and heart-shaped leaves. Can reach up to 3 metres in height. Requires full sun, rich soil and sufficient moisture.

LARKSPUR
b133
Delphinium ajacis, annual, can be biennial if sown in autumn. Blend of different colours (light blue, pink, white). Approx. 100 cm in height. Good for cutting and also for drying.
